chapter.title: COA Attribute Maintenance E-Docs
chapter.para: On the Maintenance menu tab, the Chart of Accounts submenu provides access to numerous maintenance documents for your institution's charts.

section.title: Account Type

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Account Type
> Account Type Lookup
> Account Type

section.para: The account type is an attribute of account that is used to categorize accounts for reporting.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Account Type document includes the Edit Account Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Account Type tab definition

entry.para: A two-digit code that identifies an account type
Required. A familiar title that describes an account type
Indicates whether this account type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a code.

section.title: Accounting Period

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Accounting Period
> Accounting Period Lookup
> Accounting Period

section.para: The Accounting Period document is used to define the accounting year, its subdivisions and their attributes to be used throughout the Kuali Financial System. Accounting periods usually correspond to calendar months but may include special processing periods, such as a period 'thirteen' for processing year-end closing transactions. Accounting periods are the periods to which financial transactions of any type are posted.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Accounting Period document includes the Edit Accounting Period tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Accounting Period tab definition

entry.para: The university fiscal year for the accounting period
The university fiscal period within the designated university fiscal year
Required. The familiar title for the designated university fiscal period code
Indicates whether this accounting period is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a code.

Indicates whether the sufficient funds process is in use that allows the promised budgetary funds to be carried over for the current fiscal year. Remove the check mark if the funds should not be carried over.
Required. The last day of the university fiscal period. This date may be retrieved from the calendar

section.title: Balance Type

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Balance Type
> Balance Type Lookup
> Balance Type

section.para: The Balance Type document defines the different types of balances supported by the application. Common examples include actuals, current budget, and encumbrances. Posted transactions are assigned a balance type. These different types facilitate balance reporting and financial queries.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Balance Type document includes the Edit Balance Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Balance Type tab definition

entry.para: Identifies the balance type for different uses in system processes.
Required. A descriptive title for this balance type code.
Required. An abbreviated name for a specific balance type to be used where space is limited.
Optional. Indicates if offsets are to be generated automatically by the system for the balance type. Remove the check mark if there are no offset generated entries.
Optional. Indicates if the balance type represents an encumbrance. Remove the check mark if the balance type is not an encumbrance
Indicates whether this balance type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a code.

section.title: Basic Accounting Category

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Basic Accounting Category
> Basic Accounting Category Lookup
> Basic Accounting Category

section.para: The basic accounting category code groups the object type codes into the basic accounting categories for reporting purposes.

note.para: For more details about the object type code, see Object Type.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Basic Accounting Category document includes the Edit Basic Accounting Category tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Basic Accounting Category Code tab definition

entry.para: A code for the basic accounting category that groups the object type codes for reporting purposes.
Required. The name that describes a basic accounting category code
Required. An abbreviated name for a basic accounting category code to be used for reporting where space is limited
Required. A financial reporting sort code to place fund groups in a particular sequence on reports
Indicates whether this basic accounting category code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a code.

section.title: Budget Aggregation Code

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Budget Aggregation Code
> Budget Aggregation Code Lookup
> Budget Aggregation Code

section.para: The Budget Aggregation Code document maintains the codes that indicate the level at which the object code may be aggregated for budgeting. The standard values are Object Code level ('O'), Consolidation Level ('C'), and Level ('L'). The code is referenced by the Object Code document.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Budget Aggregation Code document includes the Edit Budget Aggregation Code tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Budget Aggregation Code tab definition

entry.para: A code that uniquely identifies the level at which the budget should be aggregated for object codes.
Required. A descriptive label for this budget aggregation code.
Indicates whether this budget aggregation code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a code.

section.title: Fund Group The Fund Group document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Fund Group
> Fund Group Lookup
> Fund Group

section.para: The Fund Group document is used to define the broadest category of funds and is used for reporting and business rules. Examples of fund groups include General Funds and Contracts and Grants Funds. Although fund group is the broadest category of funds, it is an attribute of a narrower group: sub-fund. For example, accounts have an assigned sub-fund and from that sub-fund a fund group is retrieved.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Fund Group document includes the Edit Fund Group Code tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Fund Group tab definition

entry.para: The code to uniquely identify a specific fund group.
Required. The descriptive label of this specific fund group.
Required. The code to place fund groups in a particular sequence on reports

Required. The code to define the level at which business rules on the budget adjustment document are checked. Existing budget adjustment restriction code may be retrieved from the lookup
and are:
F = Fund C = Chart O = Organization A = Account
Indicates whether this fund group code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate a fund group code.

section.title: Object Consolidation Object Consolidation document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Object Consolidation
> Object Consolidation Lookup
> Object Consolidation

section.para: The Object Consolidation document defines a general category of object codes for reporting. One object consolidation includes the object codes belonging to one or more object levels.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Object Consolidation document includes the Edit Object Consolidation tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Object Consolidation tab definition

entry.para: The chart code for the associated object consolidation.
A consolidation code associated with object codes assigned to a particular reporting group of object levels.
Required. An abbreviated name used in reporting where space is limited.
Required. A descriptive label of this specific object consolidation group.
Indicates whether this object consolidation code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.
Required. The code that determines the default sort sequence on reports.

section.title: Object Level Object Level document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Object Level
> Object Level Lookup
> Object Level

section.para: The Object Level document is used to maintain an attribute of the object code that is used to group similar object codes into categories for reporting.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Object Level document includes the Edit Object Level tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Object Level tab definition

entry.para: The chart code for the associated object level
The code assigned to a particular reporting level of object codes.
Required. A descriptive label for this specific object level.
Required. An abbreviated name for this level to be used in reporting where space is limited.

Required. The consolidation object code associated with this object level code. Existing consolidation codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Indicates whether this object level code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.
Required. The code that determines the default sort sequence on reports.

section.title: Object Sub-Type Object Sub-Type document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Object Sub-Type
> Object Sub-Type Lookup
> Object Sub-Type

section.para: The Object Sub-Type document is used to further refine object type. Object sub-type can be used for reporting and in some instances for the establishment of business rules on e-docs (for example, a document might restrict the use of object codes belonging to a certain object sub-type).

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Object Sub-Type document includes the Edit Object Sub-Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Object Sub Type tab definition

entry.para: The code assigned to a particular subdivision of an object type.
Required. A descriptive label for this specific object sub-type.
Indicates whether this object sub type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Object Type Object Type document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Object Type
> Object Type Lookup
> Object Type

section.para: The Object Type document defines the general use of an object code; such as income, asset, expense, or liability.

tip.para: When you are configuring the object types, it is important to cross-reference the Object Type table, the System Options table and the OBJECT_TYPES parameters in the Parameter table.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Object Type document includes the Edit Object Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Object Type tab definition

entry.para: The code assigned to a particular object type.
Required. A descriptive label for this object type code.
Required. The default accounting balance type of debit or credit for the object code that is retrieved from the list.
The box is checked when the transactions with the object type are eligible for automated indirect cost calculation.
The box is checked when the object type code is used in the fund balance.
Required. The code that determines the default sort sequence of object types on certain reports.

Required. The basic accounting category code that groups object type codes for use in reporting and business processes throughout the system. Existing basic accounting category codes may be retrieved from the list or the lookup
.
Indicates whether this object type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Organization Type

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Organization Type
> Organization Type Lookup
> Organization Type

section.para: The Organization Type document is used to categorize organizations for reporting purposes.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Organization Type document includes the Edit Organization Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Organization Type tab definition

entry.para: The code that identifies an organization type.
Required. The descriptive name for this organization type code.
Indicates whether this restricted status code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this restrictive status code.

section.title: Restricted Status Restricted Status document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Restricted Status
> Restricted Status Lookup
> Restricted Status

section.para: The Restricted Status document is used to define whether the funds within an account are restricted, unrestricted, temporarily restricted or not applicable. Some OLE business rules refer to Restricted Status records when determining the validity of an e-doc transaction.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Restricted Status document includes the Edit Restricted Status tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Restricted Status tab definition

entry.para: The unique code that identifies a particular restricted status.
Required. The descriptive name for this restricted status code.
Indicates whether this restricted status code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this restrictive status code.

section.title: Stewardship Requirement

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Stewardship Requirement
> Stewardship Requirement Lookup
> Stewardship Requirement

section.para: The Stewardship Requirement document is used to indicate the type of stewardship on an account e-document, for example some stewardship requirements are bookplates, annual reports for donors or departments.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Stewardship Requirement document includes the Edit Stewardship Requirement tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Stewardship Type tab definition

entry.para: Identifies the type of stewardship, i.e., none, plating, reporting
Indicates whether this sub fund group type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Sub-Fund Group Sub-Fund Group document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Sub-Fund Group
> Sub-Fund Group Lookup
> Sub-Fund Group

section.para: The Sub-Fund Group document defines the type, purpose or source of funds that are found in that account. Sub-fund group may be used for reporting purposes and for business rules on OLE e-docs.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Sub-Fund Group document includes the Edit Sub-Fund Group tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Sub-Fund Group tab definition

entry.para: The unique code that identifies a particular sub-fund group.
Required. The descriptive name for this sub-fund group code.

Required. The larger fund group to which the sub-fund group is associated. Existing fund group codes may be retrieved from the lookup
.
Indicates whether this sub fund group code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

Required. A code that identifies the sub-fund group type. Existing types may be retrieved from the list or from the lookup
. Examples include: 'Auxiliary,' 'Internal Service Organizations,' or 'Neither.

A unique code that identifies a particular restricted status for the default account. Existing restricted status codes may be retrieved from the list or from the lookup
.
Required. A code that designates the default sort sequence on reports.
The box checked when the sub-fund group is one that is expected to pay compensation expenses.

Required. The code that determines at what level OLE checks for restrictions when an account of the sub-fund group is used on a Budget Adjustment e-doc from the budget adjustment restriction code list. Values retrievable from the list include:
N = None S = Sub-Fund C = Chart O = Organization A = Account

section.title: Sub-Fund Group Type Sub-Fund Group Type document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Sub-Fund Group Type
> Sub-Fund Group Type Lookup
> Sub-Fund Group Type

section.para: The Sub-Fund Group Type document defines further categorization of sub-funds. Common sub-fund group types include 'Auxiliary,' 'Internal Service Organization,' or 'Neither.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Sub-Fund Group Type document includes the Edit Sub-Fund Group Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Sub Fund Group Type tab definition

entry.para: A unique code that identifies the sub-fund group type.
Required. The descriptive name for this sub-fund group type code.
Indicates whether this sub fund group type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Sufficient Funds Check Type Sufficient Funds Code document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Sufficient Funds Check Type
> Sufficient Funds Check Type Lookup
> Sufficient Funds Check Type

section.para: The Sufficient Funds Check Type is used to define the type of sufficient fund check performed on the Account e-document.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Sufficient Funds Check Type document includes the Edit Sufficient Funds Check Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Sufficient Funds Check Type tab definition

entry.para: Identifies the type of fund to check, i.e., “account”, “object”, “cash”
Indicates whether this sufficient funds code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.

section.title: Sufficient Funds Code Sufficient Funds Code document

para.emphasis:
> Chart of Accounts
> Sufficient Funds Code
> Sufficient Funds Code Lookup
> Sufficient Funds Code

section.para: The Sufficient Funds Code document defines the codes that indicate what level the account is checked for sufficient funds in the transaction processing environment. The values are pre-determined within the system. The name of the code may be edited or the code may be deactivated.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Sufficient Funds Code document includes the Edit Sufficient Funds Code tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Sufficient Funds Code tab definition

entry.para: Display-only. A unique code that indicates what level the account is going to be checked for sufficient funds in the transaction processing environment. The values defined by the system are:
A = Account C = Consolidation H = Cash L = Level N = No Checking
Required. The descriptive name for the account sufficient funds code.
Indicates whether this sufficient funds code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate this code.
